content:
Diagnosis:		Right breast cancer - Grade 2 tall cell carcinoma

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
			15 Feb 2024 Started adjuvant letrozole

Histology:		Grade 2 tall cell carcinoma
			pT2 (32mm) N0 (0/3)
			ER 95%, PR 90%, HER2 negative

Current Situation:	Routine follow-up at 3 months post-surgery

I reviewed [redacted name] in the breast oncology follow-up clinic today. She is tolerating the adjuvant letrozole well with only mild arthralgias affecting her knees, which she manages with regular paracetamol. Her energy levels have improved since surgery and she has returned to her usual daily activities including regular swimming. The surgical site has healed well with an excellent cosmetic outcome. On examination today, there is no evidence of local recurrence, and the right axilla remains clear. Her weight is stable at 68kg.

I have provided written information about managing hormone therapy side effects. We will continue with letrozole and arrange routine mammographic surveillance at one year. She will be reviewed again in the breast clinic in 6 months' time. Blood tests including liver function will be checked by her GP in 3 months.

cancer_timeline.value: Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Histology confirms Grade 2 tall cell carcinoma pT2 (32mm) N0 (0/3 nodes)

patient_facts.value: Mild arthralgias affecting knees, managed with regular paracetamol
Surgical site well healed with excellent cosmetic outcome, no evidence of local recurrence, right axilla clear
Returned to usual daily activities including regular swimming

status_updates.value: Early breast cancer post surgery and now on adjuvant hormone therapy. Good recovery with mild treatment-related symptoms
Mammographic surveillance at one year, liver function tests in 3 months
Review in breast clinic in 6 months
